intro: Psychotria ilocana, commonly known as the Ilocano Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
